discovering her true life’s calling. She is the author of “Give A Shift: 10 Simple Steps to

an Abundant Life.”

In her first book, Megan shares the ten-step process she designed and adapted for

herself. Her “Give A Shift” program will delight and surprise you every step of the way.

It’s time to transform your life in 2018.

It’s time to Give A Shift!

Megan’s website is www.megansmithgill.com .

episodes.title: Jennie Lynn: Magnetic Love
episodes.description:
As the author of “Magnetic Love: Stop Chasing What You Want…Start Attracting It,”

Jennie Lynn can help the unattached find their soul mate. Jennie knows firsthand what it

was like to be single at Valentine’s Day before discovering her own relationship blocks.

Jennie is also a fitness fanatic, and has been a successful professional model and

earned worldwide triple Pro card status in natural figure, physique, and bodybuilding.

She began her writing career as a magazine editor, and her articles have been

published in and on the covers of Natural Gainz Magazine, Natural Mag International,

Muscle Sport Magazine, and Be Legendary Magazine.

Jennie says when you understand that "like attracts like,” you interact with the world

much like a magnet. She says magnetic love delivers a clear path that is definite, fast,

and precise. Her website is www.jennielynn.com

episodes.title: Patricia Davis  2018: Your Year of Financial Mastery
episodes.description:
2018 is here…and so are all your bills.

Today’s podcast is about upleveling your prosperity consciousness. Are you

living paycheck to paycheck? It’s time to trade in weariness and despair for

knowledge and success as you take your personal finances off life support.

Wealth expert Patricia Davis is here to show you exactly what you need to do to

get your spending back on track, raise your credit score and live the financial life

you want and deserve.

Here at MODERN LOVE, we know real healing accelerates when you have the

right tools in your toolbox.

Visit us at www.drbrendawade.com or meet me in person at our MODERN LOVE

Academy here in San Francisco.

episodes.title: Barbara Plasker: Simple Ways to Enjoy 2018
episodes.description:
If you are a procrastinator, you know it. But what you don’t know is what to do about it. How can you make changes in 2018 when you don’t realize that your life is being hijacked by unconscious thoughts?

Dr. Barbara Plasker, a procrastinator who turned into a late bloomer, is here to share a four-step technique that identifies your limited thoughts, so you can silence your inner critic.

Barbara is the author of the new book “Simple Ways to Transform Your Life: Lessons Learned by a Late Bloomer.”

Her website is www.barbaraplasker.com

episodes.title: Best of Modern Love, Bruce Cryer: Why Belief Matters
episodes.description:
BRUCE CRYER.

Bruce has a 35-year track record of helping individuals and organizations overcome significant challenges and create lucrative businesses. He joins us today to help you align your money, your mind and your heart for your greatest success ever. 


As always, we're focused on:

• Why good love is essential to your greatness

• How to identify the negative thought patterns that are blocking you from true intimacy

• How you can break the chains of "what happened" so you can be free to experience "what's now'


Bruce Cryer's passion to change the world by changing ourselves is reflected in everything he does.His first successful career was as a singer/dancer/actor on Broadway, highlighted by more than 700 performances playing the leading role in The Fantasticks, the longest-running musical in the world. 


A pioneer in the world of nutrition and biotechnology, Bruce helped create HeartMath, a groundbreaking organization he headed as President and CEO for 11 years.Bruce has written for the Harvard Business Review, been part of the faculty of the Stanford Executive Program and consulted with Fortune 50 companies throughout the US.


His website is www.brucecryer.com.

Dr. Wade is clinical psychologist, author, TV host, and motivational speaker, who inspires thousands of people each month with her dynamic range of events and free teleseminar's.

episodes.title: Sue Pighini: Ignite Your Life
episodes.description:
People are afraid of living a great life - afraid of greatness.  We play it safe and small,

settling for less than what we could be.  How can you move past the status quo, and

move beyond limited expectations and the expectations of others? 

Transformation coach and intuitive healer Sue Pighini is the author of "Expect the

Extraordinary:  Angelic Messages, Spiritual Encounters and the Soul of Skye”. Within its

pages, she presents a powerful analysis of her own life - one that has had its course

steered by divine angels along its way.

Her website is www.suepighini.com

episodes.title: Joyce Short: Healing for the Holidays
episodes.description:
Joyce Short says you can gain optimism by bolstering both your mind and your body.

“Volunteering at a soup kitchen or other helpful charity can bring you a new dimension

of self- worth, and pumping your endorphins by exercise can help you stop dwelling on

your sorrow.”

In spite of your emotional pain, she says you can move your way into a joyful frame of

mind and appreciate that you, not loss, controls your world.

And Joyce knows something about major loss and depression.

She is the author of “Combating Romance Scams, Why Lying to Get Laid Is a Crime.!”

She survived three separate incidents of sexual assault.

She advocates for victims, coaching them to overcome their trauma, seek justice, and regain their dignity She was honored this year as the New York Assembly “Woman of Distinction.”

episodes.title: Dr. Robin Burk: Check Your Connections
episodes.description:
From her early days writing code in Silicon Valley to her executive leadership in growing

companies and on to her support for a brand-new area of science, Dr. Robin Burk has

been on the leading edge of change.

Robin says you need to look at any situation from 10,000 foot as a way to get from Here

to There. In fact, she says you can do more than survive your challenges – you can

thrive despite and because of them.

Featured in Wired, MSNBC and countless media outlets, Robin translates science and

technology breakthroughs into practical steps individuals and organizations can use to

expand their resources and succeed. She’s the author of “Check Your Connections:

How to Thrive in an Uncertain World.”



Her website is www.checkyourconnections.com.

episodes.title: Jeff Hotchkiss: Putting Wisdom to Work
episodes.description:
Jeff Hotchkiss MBA is a business development consultant and author of ‘Putting Wisdom to Work, Practical Mindfulness for Maximal Living.’ He is a self-described a wisdom warrior, possibility advocate and rebel with a cause to promote mindfulness as a path of wellness. He has been an executive with Apple Computer, founder of Olivus® teas, and publishing entrepreneur.


	He has some simple strategies that can unleash the law of attraction in every aspect of

	living if you want to:


	- Stay positive naturally.

	- Shape beliefs that bend reality to avoid regrets.

	- Use acceptance to let go of resistance to change.

	- Map a more direct path to personal fulfillment.


	Jeff’s website is www.policypillars.com

episodes.title: The Best of Modern Love: Greg Braden, Resilience of the Heart
episodes.description:
Best-selling author Gregg Braden merges his expertise in leading-edge science with present-day realities to reveal the strategies for embracing stressful change in our lives. Tonight he will help you answer this question: How do I make everyday life better for myself and my family? Through his skillful synthesis of easy-to- understand science and real-life circumstances, Gregg uniquely provides the answer, describing:

? State-of- the-art discoveries that are the key to embracing big change in a healthy way

? The three shifts that will transform the way you think of your career, lifestyle, and finances

? The simple strategies of heart-based resilience that you can learn and use

His updated book Resilience From the Heart contains an all-new chapter not included in the original release, featuring material on the surprising discovery of brain-like cells—sensory neurites—located within the human heart, and the role they play in creating personal resilience. A New York Times best-selling author and 2015 Templeton Award nominee, Gregg is internationally renowned as a pioneer in bridging science, spirituality,and the real world.

His website is www.greggbraden.com.

episodes.title: Joyce Schafers: Healing Emotional Pain
episodes.description:
Joyce Schafers says her most challenging pattern to overcome has been in the area of her intimate relationships. 

In every significant intimate relationship she ever had (except for the one she is in today!), she continually found herself rejected, her partner leaving for another woman. And as much as she wanted to blame the men in the scenario, she

knew better.

She discovered there is a systematic order; to the difficult dynamic playing out between you and your partner.  Now she is instrumental in helping others heal unresolved emotional pain from the past that impacts our relationships

Her website is www.joyce-schafers.com

episodes.title: Lynette Smith: Letters of Gratitude
episodes.description:
Whereas spoken words, texts, and emails are fleeting, a gratitude letter is tangible and long-lasting. It is world-changing to its recipient, it’s saved and savored every time it’s read, and it can even become a healing part of your family

legacy. Moved by her son’s thoughtful gesture, when the night before his marriage he presented his parents with a framed letter of appreciation, Lynette M. Smith established her Good Ways to Write product line in 2009.

She started initially by writing and publishing four wedding-themed tips booklets to help brides, grooms, and their parents write letters of appreciation to one another. She has since expanded the business and appeared on countless radio and

television shows, spreading her unique message of love. Her website is www.goodwaystowrite.com.

episodes.title: Maura Sweeney: Radical Happiness
episodes.description:
After receiving a BA in Political Science from Boston College, Maura Sweeney left law school mid-stream to pioneer her own path to passion and self- determination.

A former nationally decorated corporate manager and home schooling mom who has traveled to 60 countries, Maura now purveys insightful concepts on influence and emotional intelligence. Maura has been featured in more than 250 media

outlets including NBC, BBC & Match.com. She is the author of six books on Happiness and the creator of the Foundations

of Happiness e-course.

Her website is www.maura4u.com

episodes.title: Dr. Christine Adams: The Silent Stigma
episodes.description:
Everyone gets nervous or anxious from time to time—when speaking in public, for instance, or when going through financial difficulty. For some people, however, anxiety becomes so frequent, or so forceful, that it begins to take over their lives. It’s just one of the many forms of mental illness that provoke shame and stigma.

Dr. Christine Adams has been a practicing psychiatrist for forty years. She’s co-author of “Living On Automatic: How Emotional Conditioning Shapes Our Lives and Relationships”, based on a groundbreaking new concept of personalities and

relationships. Dr. Adams is here to discuss the many ways mental health impacts the workplace, why employees hesitate to share mental health issues with bosses or coworkers, and how you can to deal with an employee or boss who may suffer mental issues.

Her website is

www.doctorchristineadams.com

episodes.title: Aurora Winter: From Heartbreak to Happiness
episodes.description:
Aurora is the author of “From Heartbreak to Happiness”, an intimate diary of healing that shares Aurora's process of healing after her husband died suddenly at the age of thirty-three, leaving her widowed with a four-year- old son.

TIME magazine reports that it typically takes 5 – 8 years to recover from a heartbreaking loss. Aurora's vision is to change this statistic by training a team of From Heartbreak to Happiness® certified coaches. These coaches will be empowered to coach the 50,000,000 heartbroken people in the US – and give them back years of joyful, meaningful life.

Aurora’s site is www.griefcoachacademy.com.

episodes.title: Brenda K. Reynolds: Finding Clarity in Confusing Times
episodes.description:
Brenda K. Reynolds’ work is based on the premise that “plan A is an illusion, so we need to get good at plan Be”— learning how to be with the uncertainty we cycle through time and again at work and in our personal lives.

As an inspiring change agent, Brenda draws on her extensive consulting and personal experiences to equip individuals and organizations with easy- to-apply strategies for managing complex transitions.

You can reach Brenda via Facebook or Twitter @ bkrconsulting.

episodes.title: Kelli Cooper: Law of Attraction Secrets
episodes.description:
Kelli Cooper went from broke, adrift and depressed to a world-traveling solopreneur. Since 2011 she and her husband have been living the digital nomad life, funding their adventures with multiple sources of income. Kelli loves sharing what she has learned about how to be a deliberate creator of your life experience because you have no idea how freaking

awesome things can be when you have a better understanding of how our

reality is truly created.

The Law of Attraction was the linchpin in changing her life, and she used this knowledge to create an independent location business she runs while her and her husband travel the world.

Her website is livelifemadetoorder.com.

episodes.title: Best of Modern Love: Michelle Walker, Your Money, Your Marriage
episodes.description: Best of Modern Love: Michelle Walker, Your Money, Your Marriage

episodes.title: Judith Costa: The Ultimate Soulmate Search
episodes.description:
Judith Costa is an Unconditional Love Coach, Seminar Leader and Speaker, with a Master’s Degree in Psychology and Psychotherapy and an MBA. She works with groups and individuals to help them overcome their inner blocks to love and to find true love. 


	She uses different techniques such as coaching, the Akashic Records, Past Life Regression Therapy, Astrology and Dream Interpretation. She has been researching about Soul Mates for more than 15 years, and her work involves teachings about what is a real Soul Mate connection, how to improve Self-Love, and how to manifest the kind of relationship all of us want. 


	Judith offers one day programs and retreats around the world. These programs include: How to Find Your Soul Mate, Fall In Love… With Yourself! & Loving Your Way To Happiness. 


	Judith Costa has a Masters degree in Psychology and Psychotherapy who specializes in helping people overcome their inner blockages to love. Like we say all the time at MODERN LOVE, “when you know better, you do better” by giving yourself the power to create and attract the relationships of your dreams.


	Her website is www.judithmcosta.com.

episodes.title: Marie Knoetig: The Body Within
episodes.description:
Marie Knoetig is a Healing Arts Practitioner, Medical intuitive, Energy Practitioner and Author of the Body Within.

Marie hopes to educate that self-healing comes from a place deep inside and create and awareness of the behaviors and outside forces that drain us and limit our ability to heal.

Tapping in to your “Body Within” opens a place of unlimited possibilities to which we all have access to aid us in our own healing.

Her website is www.marieknoetig.com.

episodes.title: Renee Jones: Emotional Eating
episodes.description:
After 40 years of yo-yo dieting, Renee Jones finally realized that losing weight and keeping it off had less to do with diet and everything to do with “emotional triggers.” With a Masters in Marriage and Family Counseling and a Clinical Residency in Pastoral Care, Renée is reaching out to the masses with her recent book “What’s Really Eating You: Overcome the Triggers of Comfort Eating”.

Through entertaining stories and easy-to- understand principles, Renée helps readers conquer comfort eating while learning how to enjoy food again.

Her website is www.packyourownbag.com.

episodes.title: Dr. Katherine T. Kelly: Soul Health
episodes.description:
Dr. Katherine T. Kelly is a licensed psychologist in her own psychotherapy and consulting practice in Winston-Salem, North Carolina. With 20+ years of direct clinical experience, Dr. Kelly doesn’t just believe in helping others to heal; instead, her mission is to help them to evolve.

Using her own integrative framework called the “Soul Health Model,” Dr. Kelly approaches her work with clients from a psycho-spiritual perspective. She thrives as she helps clients to reach what she calls “conscious evolution” as part of their soul development.

Her website is www.drkatherinetkelly.com. (Katherine T Kelly dot com)

episodes.title: Dr. Susan Edelma: Be Your Own Brand of Sexy
episodes.description:
Dr. Susan Edelman helps single women reclaim their power—by learning what works

	best for them—instead of what they’re programmed to believe is “normal by today’s

	culture.

	The sexual revolution promised more choices. But sadly, women today are as confused

	as ever. We went from “if you have sex before marriage, you’re a tramp” to “if you’re a

	virgin, you’re a prude.”

	Why?  Because we forgot the meaning of liberation: the freedom to choose for yourself.

	Dr. Susan is the author of the multi award-winning book, Be Your Own Brand of Sexy:

	A New Sexual Revolution for Women.

	In addition to her private practice, she is an Adjunct Clinical Associate Professor at

	Stanford University in the Department of Psychiatry and Behavioral Sciences

	Her website is www.beyourownbrandofsexy.com.

episodes.title: William Kaplanidis: Love Your Inner Children!
episodes.description:
With advanced training in psychology, East-Asian medicine and martial arts, William Kaplanidis fuses Eastern and Western healing methods. William is an internationally renowned healer who has worked with Olympic athletes, professional dancers, corporate executives and many other individuals who have experienced stress and pain.

Just when you thought you had only one inner child, William Kaplanidis comes along to suggest that you may have multiple inner children—one for every major trauma experienced in your early childhood! Tonight, we’re going to talk about the real reason some people overreact to certain situations, the triggers that activate a person’s normally hidden inner children, and how to tell if your symptoms and ailments are connected to stuck energy.

“Acudragon Wellness System” is the name given to encompass the various modalities employed by William to assist people to achieve their goals and find their own path in life. His new book is “How to be a Great Parent to Your Inner Child: Connect with Your Heart and Higher Purpose.”

William’s website is www.acudragon.us

episodes.title: Mitchell Walker Topic: Your Money, Your Marriage
episodes.description:
GUEST INTRO

	Tonight, you’ll learn three things that can practically divorce-proof your marriage.

	Mitchell Walker is a former vice president of finance for a Berkshire Hathaway company.

	For many years, Mitchell’s passion has been helping people improve their personal

	financial situations. He believes and shares this key message: “If you do money right,

	life gets easier. You do money wrong, and life gets harder.”


	Twenty-five years ago, when he was more than $100,000 in debt and had no assets, he

	dug his way out by discovering and refining ‘The Pouch Plan.”


	The Pouch Plan was developed based on his expertise, but more importantly, was put

	to the test and proven by Mitchell and his wife Suzanne over 20 plus years as they

	raised their blended family of seven.


	His book, “The Pouch Plan Budget: The Simple Way to Find Hidden Money, Improve

	Your Life and Build Wealth,” is based on his own extensive experience. His website is

	www.pouchplan.com.

episodes.title: Antonia Hall: The Multi-Orgasmic Life
episodes.description:
Antonia Hall is a frequent radio and TV guest expert, a regular contributor to top magazines and is the author of bestselling book, The Ultimate Guide to a Multi- orgasmic Life, which won an Independent Publisher Book Award (IPPY) and NationalIndie Excellence Book Award.

A revolutionary book for our changing world, The Ultimate Guide to a Multi-Orgasmic Life is a guide to mindful passionate living, heart intelligence, gratitude and happiness in all areas of one’s life, as well as being a guide to becoming multi-orgasmic for men and women. Her website is www.antoniahall.com.

episodes.title: Heidi Crockett: The Neuroscience of Dating
episodes.description:
Who isn’t confused about dating these days?

In order to survive today’s complex dating scene, what the HECK is a good guy or gal to do? Heidi Crockett outlines brain integration as a solution for dating difficulties. Heidi applies well-researched neuroscience principles to screening people and finding love. Heidi Crockett graduated cum laude from Middlebury College, has her Masters from the University of Georgia, and post-graduate training from the University of Michigan. She is a licensed psychotherapist and a nationally-certified sexuality educator. Heidi’s search for dating relevance started with a tragedy. On the heels of her husband’s death, she found herself encountering many different dating perils.

My guest tonight addresses sex and stress-related topics by using relational neuroscience.  In her book,The Neuroscience of Dating; Heidi Crockett explains why brain integration is the Holy Grail for finding and keeping good relationships specifically when dating. Her website is www.heidicrockett.com.

episodes.title: Best Of Modern Love Radio: Bruce Cryer: Why Belief Matters
episodes.description:
BRUCE CRYER.

Bruce has a 35-year track record of helping individuals and organizations overcome significant challenges and create lucrative businesses. He joins us today to help you align your money, your mind and your heart for your greatest success ever. 


As always, we're focused on:

• Why good love is essential to your greatness

• How to identify the negative thought patterns that are blocking you from true intimacy

• How you can break the chains of "what happened" so you can be free to experience "what's now'


Bruce Cryer's passion to change the world by changing ourselves is reflected in everything he does.His first successful career was as a singer/dancer/actor on Broadway, highlighted by more than 700 performances playing the leading role in The Fantasticks, the longest-running musical in the world. 


A pioneer in the world of nutrition and biotechnology, Bruce helped create HeartMath, a groundbreaking organization he headed as President and CEO for 11 years.Bruce has written for the Harvard Business Review, been part of the faculty of the Stanford Executive Program and consulted with Fortune 50 companies throughout the US.


His website is www.brucecryer.com.

Dr. Wade is clinical psychologist, author, TV host, and motivational speaker, who inspires thousands of people each month with her dynamic range of events and free teleseminar's.

episodes.title: Laura L. Reagan: A Parent's Guide to Summertime Teens
episodes.description:
Laura Lyles Reagan, the Teen and Parent Relationship Whisperer, has tips for creating a fun and meaningful summer with your teen. A family sociologist with her own teenage daughter, Laura will suggest

? ways to connect with a surly teen

? where to draw the line in the sand

? how to get a grip on teen culture without your teen thinking you’re lame,

? how to get your teen to want to spend time with you…and love it!

Laura is a parenting expert, speaker, experienced talk show guest, and the author of “How to Raise Respectful Parents.” Her website is www.lauralreagan.com.

episodes.title: Meggie Jones: Inside/Outside Love
episodes.description:
Meggie Jones grew up eating all the wrong kinds of foods and using them as her source of comfort. For years, she struggled with weight and low self-esteem before embarking on a stunning transformation of self-love.

Meggie is the founder of Nutrient Body Sculpt, a revolutionary company making waves in the health/beauty business world. You can find her at www.nutrientbodysculpt.com. The once-tiny shred of belief in herself has transformed and grown into a life mission: to help others, especially teens, discover their “skinny” spirits and sculpt their bodies into healthier works of art.

Born into an extremely dysfunctional family, Meggie was kidnapped by an abusive father when she was five. By the age of fifteen, she had successfully petitioned the school court to commission for the right to be my own guardian. With determination and ingenuity, including attending her own parent-teacher conferences, she was able to graduate high school. Yet, as the difficulties of life weighed heavily upon her, she was suicidal.

Nutrient Body Sculpt hydrates the body, while at the same time enhancing your body’s natural profile. The body sculpting system is a noninvasive treatment which helps:

? aid metabolism

? build enzymes

? support the immune system

? tighten and tone skin

www,nutrientbodysculpt.com

episodes.title: Valerie Joi: Music of the Heart
episodes.description:
Valerie Joi’s music emanates a joy rooted in freedom and authenticity. A gifted and multifaceted musician, Valerie Joi has worked as a pianist, vocalist, composer, vocal coach, arranger and producer. She also directed the UC Santa Cruz

Gospel Choir for thirteen years, where she was named a Porter College Faculty Fellow by the university. A highlight of her musical career thus far has been singing background vocals for Quincy Jones at the 2016 Monterey Jazz Festival (and upcoming this year at the Hollywood Bowl in September). Her greatest joy is witnessing transformation and healing through song.

Currently, Valerie Joi is also a PhD student in Transformative Studies at the California Institute of Integral Studies, where she is focusing on the interconnection between music, spirituality and social activism. Her website is www.valeriejoi.com.

episodes.title: The Best of Modern Love Podcast: Tamara Star: 7 Traits of Unhappy People
episodes.description: Tamara Star brings a unique perspective to GOOD LOVE that crosses cultural, socioeconomic, business, and egoic barriers.  She’s spent over 25 years as a straight shooting guide delivering intuitive truth while utilizing traditional and non-traditional methods to get results. With one foot deeply rooted in the world of main stream business, psychology & coaching, and the other firmly planted in what many consider the alternative healing world of energy,

episodes.title: Katia Loisel: What's Your Love Destination?
episodes.description:
Direct from Australia, Katia Loisel is an internationally recognized dating and relationship expert with two decades experience in the TV industry. She is the co-author of “How To Get The Man/Woman You Want” and has conducted a widely published five-year global study about dating and mating patterns.


	A sought after media commentator and host, Katia has been interviewed over 900 times by media outlets worldwide. Her latest project includes the launch of an online ‘how to’ campaign for the dating and relationship market that has generated over 12 million views.


	Katia is also the founder of a new website The Love Destination. Her site is www.thelovedestination.com.

episodes.title: Karin Roest: Different is the New Normal
episodes.description:
Karin Roest was born in Korea, adopted by Dutch-American parents, and raised in a family with five nationalities in the Pacific Northwest. She has spent the last 20 years living in Africa, Latin America, and Asia on the ultimate, unplanned, fly-by- the-seat- of-her-pants MasterQuest.

From dodging bullets and bombs in Sudan to meditating for one year in silence in Myanmar to nonstop partying as a global producer and celebrity scout in 39 countries, she has led an amazing life that is only just beginning. In addition to working with many celebrities, she has worked with big name companies such as BMW, Coca Cola and LG.

Tonight, Karin will share pieces of her own life story to help you realize that “different is the new normal” as you bring your best self to your relationships. Her website is www.karinroest.com.

episodes.title: Shajen Joy: Discover the Gift
episodes.description:
Shajen Joy is an international best-selling author, master educator and personal and corporate trainer.  She is most passionate about creating a world where our children can thrive in powerful and positive ways.  She is a speaker, teacher, and co- Creator of the international bestselling book and film Discover the Gift- It’s Why We’re Here.  This project is published in 22 countries and ten languages.

Shajen is regularly featured on The Shift Network and was most recently featured alongside Deepak Chopra, Marianne Williamson, Desmond Tutu, Barbara Marx Hubbard, and Eckhart Tolle. Shajen’s work has been featured in The Huffington Post, ABC, NBC, CNN and Destiny Magazine, Examiner.com, amongst numerous other international outlets. Her website is

www.discoverthegift.com.

episodes.title: Marci Shimoff: Happy For No Reason
episodes.description:
Meet one of the bestselling female nonfiction authors of all time.

Marci Shimoff is the author of the runaway bestsellers, Happy for No Reason, Love for No Reason, and six titles in the phenomenally successful Chicken Soup for the Woman’s Soul series. She’s here tonight to share the secrets of happiness and real love.

Here at MODERN LOVE, we know real love starts with communication about how the past affects your future. From workshops to mastermind groups to couples’ therapy, we bring together psychology, science and spirituality to create massive change in your life. If you’re interested in

? Finding love after giving up

? Healing a marriage on the brink of divorce

? Creating an exciting successful new career

Visit us at www.drbrendawade.com or meet me in person at our MODERN LOVE

Academy here in San Francisco.

episodes.title: Chamin Ajjan: Ditch the Dating Game
episodes.description:
In her book SEEKING SOULMATE: Ditch the Dating Game and Find Real Connection, Chamin Ajjan offers a friendly, funny, and informative approach to dating.

She applies the evidence-based theories of Cognitive Behavior Therapy (CBT) and mindfulness meditation practice to the negative behaviors, thoughts, and patterns that cause dating distress. Chamin provides an alternative to the stressful, disappointing, lonely dating traps so many people fall into and is here tonight to help you overcomedating sabotage. Her website is www.chaminajjan.com.

Meet Chamin Ajjan, an amazing psychoherapist who will provide an explanation for your dating difficulties. She’s here to offer practical exercises to create real change regardless of your age, ethnic or religious background, or sexual orientation.

episodes.title: Dr. John Kim: The No BS Guide to Life
episodes.description:
Talk about unconventional.

John Kim practices complete authenticity and transparency with his many clients, frowned upon in the clinical world, and continues to look for new and unconventional ways to help people. John lives in Los Angeles where he makes videos on his phone, Crossfits, and rides his motorcycle to coffee shops to do sessions. His work has been covered in TheAtlantic.com, Hyphen, Psychology Today, MindBodyGreen.com an NPR.com.

Joh has made it his mission to remove the wall separating therapist from client, preferring a transparent style not commonly seen in therapy. Kim speaks a different therapeutic language and people have responded to it via his Angry

Therapist blog at www.theangrytherapist.com

episodes.title: Dr. Shaelyn Pham: Are You Hooked on Hookups?
episodes.description:
If greater success and fulfillment is what you seek, then Dr. Shaelyn Pham can help you achieve the life you desire.  

For more than a decade, Dr. Pham has been counseling, teaching, and training doctors, lawyers, entrepreneurs, educators, and people from all walks of life to go from where they are to where they want to be – and she could do the same for you! Her website is www.drshaelynpham.com.

episodes.title: Dr. Arlene Drake: Toxic Love Secrets
episodes.description:
Arlene Drake is a psychotherapist specializing in trauma recovery and a pioneer in the field of adult survivors of sexual abuse. Her groundbreaking new book, Carefrontation: Breaking Free from Childhood Trauma is a powerful roadmap that helps survivors break free of all the lies, secrets, and shame of the past to reclaim their genuine self.

Dr. Arlene has long been a passionate crusader for victims’ rights and has been featured in media outlets including the Los Angeles Times, People magazine, Newsweek, USA Today, and ABC World News Tonight.

She teaches how to heal the wounds of a miserable childhood by coming to that child as a compassionate adult with the heart and mind and guts to rescue it, and show it how to grow up. Her website is www.arlenedrake.com.

episodes.title: Neale Godfrey: Financial Infidelity
episodes.description:
Neale S. Godfrey is an acknowledged expert on family and children’s finances with over 30 years in the financial field. In 1989, Neale formed her own company, Children’s Financial Network, Inc., whose mission is to educate children and their parents about money. She is the author of 27 books that deal with money, life skills, and value issues, and has been honored with a #1 New York Times best seller, Money Doesn’t Grow on Trees: A Parent’s Guide to Raising Financially Responsible Children. She’s also the creator of GreenStreets, the #1 educational app for iTunes.

Neale has served as a National Spokesperson for such companies as: Aetna, Microsoft, Coca-Cola, and Fidelity, while appearing as a financial expert on programs, such as; The Oprah Winfrey Show, Good Morning America, and The Today Show as well as in the PBS special Your Money, Your Children, Your Life. She’s currently the voice for Baby Boomers, millennials and their offspring in her online articles for Forbes magazine which have reached six million readers.

Neale’s website is www.greenstreetcommons.com.

episodes.title: Michael Evans: Toxic Blind Spots
episodes.description:
In his book Borrowed Theme, our guest Michael Evans makes the case that living in blind faith keeps people trapped in a mechanical life and prevents us from achieving our true life’s potential.

Michael is a successful businessman and published author, but in college, he contemplated suicide, and realized he had nothing to lose by chasing his true dreams.He turned to philosophy, literature and more recently, to science, studying astrophysics at the University of Copenhagens distant learning program. He is now CEO of an international security company, a devoted husband and father who lives each and every one of his 27,000 days in the present moment.

Michael argues that the “collective beliefs” people have today regarding religion, politics, morals and often marriage are outdated, nonsensical, and in many cases, dangerous. His first book was titled “The Real Matrix.” His website is www.therealmatrixbook.net.

episodes.title: Terry Real: How to Make Love Work
episodes.description:
Terry Real is an internationally recognized family therapist, speaker and author. Terry founded the Relational Life Institute, offering workshops for couples, individuals and parents around the country along with a professional training program for clinicians wanting to learn his RLT (Relational Life Therapy) methodology.

A family therapist and teacher for more than twenty-five years, Terry is the best-selling author of I Don’t Want to Talk About It: Overcoming the Secret Legacy of Male Depression, the straight- talking How Can I Get Through to You? Reconnecting Men and Women and most recently The New Rules of Marriage: What You Need to Make Love Work.

Terry’s work, with its rigorous commonsense approach, speaks to both men and women. His ideas on men’s issues and on couples therapy have been celebrated in venues from the Good Morning America, The Today Show and 20/20, to Oprah and The New York Times. A proponent of “full-throttle marriage,” as described in The New Rules of Marriage, Terry has been called “the most innovative voice in thinking about and treating men and their relationships in the world today.” Terry knows how to lead couples on a step-by- step journey to greater intimacy — and greater personal fulfillment.

His website is www.terryreal.com.

episodes.title: Roe and Don Polczynski:  Raise Your Love Vibration
episodes.description:
Married duo Roe and Don Polcyznski Jr. want our listeners to think about this: What is your inner selfie? The authors of “Changing Your Equation, they say most of us have never taken a good look at our personalities, natural tendencies, talents and interests and therefore don’t know ourselves as well as we think.

Roe and Don have built a successful relationship, founded on leadership principles. Together we have amassed two master’s degrees in business administration and management and have more than thirty-five years of management and leadership experience.

Over the course of their marriage, they’ve picked up and shared many of the insights they wished others had taught along the way. They say the goal of any partnership should be to look beyond love and learn how to create your ideal future as a couple. In their recently released book, “Changing Your Equation,” they show the pathway to love, prosperity and gratitude.

Their website is www.changeyourequation.com.

episodes.title: The Best of Modern Love: Dr. Paul Coleman
episodes.description:
Dr. Paul Coleman is a nationally known psychologist and author in private practice with thirty years of experience. He has written thirteen books with traditional publishers including his latest “FINDING PEACE WHEN YOUR HEART IS IN PIECES” (Adams Media, November 2014) as well as “We Need to Talk: Tough Conversations with Your Spouse”

Dr. Coleman is an expert in the treatment of PTSD, Anxiety Disorders, Grief, and Couples Therapy. He takes a particular interest in helping people discover meaning and purpose to their lives after a major loss or upheaval.

He has appeared on national television shows such as Oprah, Today, Geraldo, The Morning Show with Mike & Juliet, Good Day New York, as well as dozens of radio programs across the country including mega-stations WABC and WOR in New York. He has been quoted in numerous popular magazines such as Cosmopolitan, Redbook, Spirituality & Health, Real Simple, Reader’s Digest, First for Women, and several others.

http://www.paul-coleman.com/

episodes.title: Tami West: Love and Stress
episodes.description:
Welcome to the final episode of our Love Month series, “Jumpstart Your Love.”Tonight’s segment is centered on self-love and how it relates to stress, particularly for women.

Dr. Tami West has been helping women take their power back and live their own lives for over 15 years. Her passion stems from a lifelong battle with anxiety disorder that initiated her dedication to women and their emotional health. Her clients come from all walks of life. Danbury Federal Prison inmates (the setting of the Netflix Emmy-winning series Orange is the New Black, as well as the prison home for Martha Stewart) found Tami to be genuine and real, with good practical messages and coping skills.

Tami is uniquely equipped to address the human factor that underlies the success of women, both personally and professionally. Her publications include The Stress Club, A Woman’s Guide to Personal Achievement and Professional Success, and Life Without the Monsters.

Her website is www.tamiwest.com.

episodes.title: Angela Howell: Finding Your True Heart
episodes.description:
It’s Love Month and tonight is the third installment of our series “Jump Start Your Heart.


	Our guest tonight says true love emerges from a grateful heart…and a grateful heart starts with mindfulness. In her book Finding the Gift, Angela Howell has captured 366 unique meditations to help readers see life from a greater perspective, so they can really “get the lesson” and apply new insights to their own lives. As we embrace mindful living and improve how we show up in the world, the world becomes a better place for everyone…and this especially shows up in your love life.


	One of our favorite returning guests here at MODERN LOVE, Angela has long been on the road to personal freedom. She survived a lengthy battle with anorexia and bulimia, and went on to earn multiple sales awards and top recognition with several Fortune 500 companies. She now shares her compelling story of triumph with a variety of audiences and uses her coaching program to help clients create A Life Worth Having.


	Her website is www.angelahowell.com.

episodes.title: Nicolas Bearde: The Music of Love
episodes.description:
When all is said and done, music is the balm that soothes the soul. According to Psychology Today, here are the top 4 reasons music affects our love lives;

? Music boosts our hormones

? Music makes you easier to approach

? Music influences how you see potential partners

? Music = Pleasure = Sex

This Valentine’s Day, we are going beyond words to explore “The Music of Love” on this very

Special edition of Modern Love. Take a listen:

Nicolas Bearde’s latest album, which is nestled firmly in the Top 20 of the Jazz Week Charts. This new work sizzles with selections from the classic jazz songbook and tonight our guest is the one and only Nicolas Bearde himself.

An accomplished actor as well, Nicolas is a jazz singer of remarkable depth, range and technique who has won acclaim from critics and jazz audiences worldwide for his buttery baritone; and imaginative interpretations. His brilliant and lush vocals combine passion, wit and sensuality. Nicolas’ unique approach and electrifying delivery of his originals, time-tested standards, blues and other familiar jazz works, are soulful, swinging, improvisational and memorable!!

episodes.title: Michelle Nagel: Soul Shift Your Love
episodes.description:
Valentine’s Day is one week away and it’s time to shift into gear with MODERN LOVE. Tonight is Part Two of our four-part series “Jumpstart Your Love.”

Question: can you time travel into your past to improve your love life today? Tonight’s guest says “Yes, you can!” and she’s here to show us how. The president of SoulShift Inc, Michelle Nagel is committed to making the world a better, happier place for everyone in it. She’s a transformational trainer, master herbalist and energy therapist. She has been leading workshops for over 15 years, empowering people to take responsibility for their own health and emotional well-being.

Michelle’s recent book, Suffering is Optional: Step Out of Darkness Into the Light is a guide to help people identify and overcome past traumas so they can live a vibrant and fulfilled life. Through years of study, Michelle developed a process called Soul Shift that empowers clients to overcome the limiting beliefs and negative patterns that keep them from livinga more fulfilling life. Her website is www.isoulshift.com

episodes.title: Dr. Stacey Robinson: Better Brain, Better Love
episodes.description:
It’s Love Month here at Modern Love and we’re kicking off with a four-part series on how to love yourself better. Tonight we’re going to talk about that most important organ of all when it comes to love: your brain! (What were you thinking, dear listener?)

As Valentine’s Day approaches, it is again time to assess. The best gift you can give your lover is to bring optimum health and emotional wellness into the relationship. My guest tonight says stress, lack of exercise, and poor nutrition are killing us slowly. She says we need to follow eight essentials of health to feel, live and love better.

Meet Dr. Stacey Robinson. She was born and raised in Red Bluff, a rural town in northern California. When she entered undergrad at California State University at Long Beach, she only knew that she had a deeply ingrained need to care for people. After she realized that medicine was her calling, she attended Tulane University School of Medicine on an Air Force scholarship, graduating at the top of her class in 1996.

Dr. Stacey is now a functional medicine physician and the author of “Road Map to Health. “ To improve your love life, she will explain what you should be eating, which daily supplements to take, why your toothbrush type matters, and what special blood tests to ask your physician about.

episodes.title: Brenda K. Reynolds: Trump, Transition and You!
episodes.description:
The one thing everyone can agree on right now is that the future is TBD…To Be Determined. The question on everyone’s minds is “now what?” With the recent Inauguration of President Donald Trump and the historic Women’s Marches around the globe, a whole lot is shakin’ in this world. Whether it’s the transition our nation faces, your own personal transition or a change in your business or love life, tonight’s guest will give you greater clarity and confidence about your next right step.

Brenda K. Reynolds is a renowned business and change management consultant, coach, and facilitator who has worked with hundreds of major corporations, nonprofits and organizations including, McDonald’s, Special Olympics and Sherwin Williams to manage the people side of change for more than 23 years. Brenda is a “Now what?” expert and author of the upcoming book TBD-To Be Determined: How to Find Clarity and Confidence in Uncertain Times, available April 2017. She is an inspiring change agent who draws on her consulting and personal experiences to equip audiences with easy-to- apply strategies for managing complex transitions. You can reach Brenda via Facebook or Twitter @ bkrconsulting.

episodes.title: Dr. Don MacDonald: Stop People Pleasing in 2017
episodes.description:
Want a better love life that starts with the word “no!”? Want to have less stress, sleep better, get fewer colds and flus and avoid headaches and heartburn? Doing so may be as simple as saying no to obligations, chores and social commitments you agree to just to make other people happy.

People pleasers put everyone else before themselves. For some, saying “yes” is almost an addiction that ties them in knots and puts relationships with loved ones in peril. Our guest is on a rescue mission to transform the lives of emotional caretakers. Dr. Don MacDonald is a recovering people-pleaser and chiropractor. He realized many of his patients were coming into his office due to stress-related conditions fueled by their own excess worries and inability to say no for their own good. Tonight Dr. Don will explain how to decide in advance what you will and won’t do. This will lead to a healthier and happier 2017. Dr. Don is the bestselling author of “The Underdog Curse.” His website is www.theunderdogcurse.com.

episodes.title: The Best of Modern Love Radio: Bruce Cryer, Why Belief Matters
episodes.description:
BRUCE CRYER.

Bruce has a 35-year track record of helping individuals and organizations overcome significant challenges and create lucrative businesses. He joins us today to help you align your money, your mind and your heart for your greatest success ever. 


As always, we're focused on:

• Why good love is essential to your greatness

• How to identify the negative thought patterns that are blocking you from true intimacy

• How you can break the chains of "what happened" so you can be free to experience "what's now'


Bruce Cryer's passion to change the world by changing ourselves is reflected in everything he does.His first successful career was as a singer/dancer/actor on Broadway, highlighted by more than 700 performances playing the leading role in The Fantasticks, the longest-running musical in the world. 


A pioneer in the world of nutrition and biotechnology, Bruce helped create HeartMath, a groundbreaking organization he headed as President and CEO for 11 years.Bruce has written for the Harvard Business Review, been part of the faculty of the Stanford Executive Program and consulted with Fortune 50 companies throughout the US.


His website is www.brucecryer.com.

Dr. Wade is clinical psychologist, author, TV host, and motivational speaker, who inspires thousands of people each month with her dynamic range of events and free teleseminar's.

episodes.title: The Best of Modern Love Radio: Hot Mahogany
episodes.description:
Dr. Pat Love is known for her warmth, humor, and practical, research-based wisdom. Her blog posts, YouTube clips, books, trainings, workshops, and online courses have made her a popular go-to relationship consultant. Her work has been featured on TV, in cyberspace, and popular magazines, but she’s also a distinguished professor, licensed marriage and family therapist, and long-standing clinical member and approved supervisor in American Association for Marriage and Family Therapy.

Dr. Love (yes that is her real surname) has authored/co-authored six books, four workbooks, and numerous professional publications. Her work literally has taken her around the world to help people understand and improve their relationships.

Dr. Love received her doctor of education in counselor education from West Virginia University. She was a tenured associate professor at Texas A&M University in Commerce, Texas for six years before establishing the Austin Family Institute in Austin, Texas. Dr. Love also served as president of the International Association for Marriage and Family Counseling.

Today, she continues following her passion to help others through her writing and as a relationship consultant, trainer, and workshop presenter.

Dr. Wade is clinical psychologist, author, TV host, and motivational speaker, who inspires thousands of people each month with her dynamic range of events and free teleseminar's.

episodes.title: Nanci Danison: Lessons From the Afterlife
episodes.description:
Is everything we know about life after death completely and totally wrong? So says tonight’s provocative guest who experienced a spiritual awakening that took her to the other side.  

Meet Nanci Danison. Her book “Answers From The Afterlife” sheds new light on many traditional spiritual beliefs, whether ghosts are real, after-death communications without a medium, soul mates and more. Even if you’re a skeptic, she says this new information can transform your love relationships and accelerate healing among feuding family members.

Nanci is a writer, a retired health care lawyer and former litigator in a prestigious 270-attorney law firm. “Answers from the Afterlife” is her fourth book that expands on the information she obtained during an After Death Experience in 1994.

Nanci brings the credibility of a trial lawyer trained to evaluate evidence to our most pressing spiritual questions. In a phrase, she says, “I went backwards in order to go forward”. Her website is www.backwardsbooks.com.

episodes.title: Joyce Keller: What’s Your Love Forecast?
episodes.description:
This time of year is magic time… 2016 is almost over but 2017 is ahead with its infinite possibilities. So my question is this: are you living your best life possible given all you learned this year?

Renowned visionary Edgar Cayce once said: “Each soul has a definite job to do. But only you alone may find and do that job.” Tonight, we’re going to explore that sentiment fully with one of the country’s most acclaimed intuitives. Meet Joyce Keller, America’s #1 Psychic Love Coach. Featured on Oprah and many other shows, she is an author, and psychic medium who has hosted a live radio show since 1989 on New York’s WGBB. Joyce has also been featured in both editions of the book, 100 Top Psychics in America and has authored seven international best-selling books including Why Am I Here? A Concise Guide to Your Purpose and Potential. Her website is www.joycekeller.com and her books are available for purchase at www.AREcatalog.com.

episodes.title: Best of Modern Love Radio: Greg Braden: Resilience From the Heart
episodes.description:
Best-selling author Gregg Braden merges his expertise in leading-edge science with present-day realities to reveal the strategies for embracing stressful change in our lives. Tonight he will help you answer this question: How do I make everyday life better for myself and my family? Through his skillful synthesis of easy-to- understand science and real-life circumstances, Gregg uniquely provides the answer, describing:

? State-of- the-art discoveries that are the key to embracing big change in a healthy way

? The three shifts that will transform the way you think of your career, lifestyle, and finances

? The simple strategies of heart-based resilience that you can learn and use

His updated book Resilience From the Heart contains an all-new chapter not included in the original release, featuring material on the surprising discovery of brain-like cells—sensory neurites—located within the human heart, and the role they play in creating personal resilience. A New York Times best-selling author and 2015 Templeton Award nominee, Gregg is internationally renowned as a pioneer in bridging science, spirituality,and the real world.

His website is www.greggbraden.com.

episodes.title: The Best of Modern Love Radio:  Julie Christopher, Love and Marriage
episodes.description:
We all know that classic song “Love and Marriage” but tonight we’re exploring the powerful link between “love and intuition”…

With only $50, a guitar, and not speaking any English, Julie Christopher arrived in Los Angeles as a homeless immigrant. Relying only on instinct & intuition, Julie continued her music career and eventually performed on the Grand Ole Opry stage.

During her journey, she also published her own yoga training DVD. Many of her clients were entrepreneurs and executives who confided in Julie their challenges and obstacles in business and life…

As a result, Julie developed a blend of meditation, yoga, and intuition to coach professionals to become better leaders. Tonight she will share her “biztuition” process to attract riches–and love –into your life.

Julie;s been interviewed on nationally syndicated shows like Dr. Drew, Nancy Grace, Legal View with Ashleigh Banfield among others. Her website is

https://www.facebook.com/Biztuition/?fref=nf

episodes.title: The Best of Modern Love: Dr. Pat Love: Hot Monogamy
episodes.description:
Dr. Pat Love is known for her warmth, humor, and practical, research-based wisdom. Her blog posts, YouTube clips, books, trainings, workshops, and online courses have made her a popular go-to relationship consultant. Her work has been featured on TV, in cyberspace, and popular magazines, but she’s also a distinguished professor, licensed marriage and family therapist, and long-standing clinical member and approved supervisor in American Association for Marriage and Family Therapy.

Dr. Love (yes that is her real surname) has authored/co-authored six books, four workbooks, and numerous professional publications. Her work literally has taken her around the world to help people understand and improve their relationships.

Dr. Love received her doctor of education in counselor education from West Virginia University. She was a tenured associate professor at Texas A&M University in Commerce, Texas for six years before establishing the Austin Family Institute in Austin, Texas. Dr. Love also served as president of the International Association for Marriage and Family Counseling.

Today, she continues following her passion to help others through her writing and as a relationship consultant, trainer, and workshop presenter.

Dr. Wade is clinical psychologist, author, TV host, and motivational speaker, who inspires thousands of people each month with her dynamic range of events and free teleseminar's.

episodes.title: Dr. Elaina George: What Every Doctor Wants You to Know!
episodes.description:
The recent election of Donald Trump has heightened anxiety across the country—especially around the issue of health care and what it might mean for your family.

Tonight we want to offer an expanded discussion about how our current health system affects your relationships and your future. In her book “ Big Medicine,” Dr. Elaina George explores five reasons why the current healthcare system is unsustainable. She offers the unique perspective from the practicing physician and discusses solutions on how to fix it.

A graduate of Princeton University with a degree in biology, Dr Elaina George is a Board Certified Otolaryngologist.. She is on the advisory council of Project 21 Black leadership network, and hosts her own radio show, "Medicine On Call.”

Her website is www.drelainageorge.com.

episodes.title: Florence Ann Romano: The New Parent Trap
episodes.description:
Everything changes when the baby comes… but here’s something that often gets overlooked: working mother’s guilt. How do you avoid the “new parent trap” when you feel torn between two worlds? We’re also going to answer a popular listenerquestion we’ve received in our voicemail: “How do I deal with disrespectful children?”

Tonight’s guest is a firecracker! Known as the Windy City Nanny, Florence Ann Romano has a unique perspective on parenting…and great advice every mother should hear. Florence worked for over 15 years as a nanny, beginning as a Mommy;s helper at the age of 11. She shares her experiences in “Nanny and Me”, her beautifully illustrated debut book for children making the transition from being cared for solely by their parents to having a nanny in their home.

Florence’s website is her name: www.florenceannromano.com.

episodes.title: Dr. Frieda Birnbaum: How to Repair Your Relationships AFTER The Election
episodes.description:
Has Donald Trump or Hillary Clinton affected your love life? You’d be surprised at the answer many give! Race and education were traditionally what we used to look for in potential partners. But now political affiliation is having a great effect.

Tonight’s show is about the devastating effect the presidential campaign has had on personal relationships. What do you do when someone you love has a dramatically different political view? Facebook research reveals a whopping 34% of its users report de-friending someone over a political post this year. No matter which candidate ultimately wins the presidential election, some friendships will never be the same. Psychoanalyst Frieda Birnbaum is here to share why this election—more than previous ones—is causing more stress on relationships and whether losing a friend because of political differences is an indication that the friendship wasn’t a strong one to begin with.

Based in New York City, Dr Frieda is a research psychologist and author of “What Price Power: An In-Depth Study of the Professional Woman in a Relationship.” She’s an expert on depression, women’s issues, and attaining happiness. She has also been featured on Oprah & 20/20 as the oldest nom in the USA to have twins—at age 60! Her website is www.doctorfrieda.com.

episodes.title: Colleen O Grady:  Mother/Daughter Conflict
episodes.description:
Get ready, Modern Lovers! Tonight we’re tackling an issue that’s bedeviling mothers everywhere: how do you deal with the precious daughter you brought into the world when she starts to see you as her archenemy? Colleen O’Grady is the author of Dial Down the Drama: Reducing Conflict and Reconnecting with Your Teenage Daughter -- -- A Guide for Mothers Everywhere. Colleen is also a seasoned licensed marriage and family therapist for 25 years; nineteen of those she trained psychiatry and psychology residents in both the child and adolescent department at major hospitals.


	Colleen, known as an expert on teens in her community, found her real expertise was earned in the trenches with her own teenage daughter. Now, Colleen is changing mother-daughter relationships around the world with her Power YourParenting programs, podcast and workshops. Her website is www.colleenogrady.com.

episodes.title: Dr. Judy Morgan: For the Love of Pets
episodes.description:
Did you know that how you take care of your pets has a direct correlation on your love life? Consider this: The saying "love me, love my dog" may have some basis in reality: A new study suggests that pets can influence how we perceive potential dates.


	Pets “add some twists and turns to our love lives," says study co-author Justin Garcia, an evolutionary biologist at the Kinsey Institute at Indiana University and scientific advisor for the dating website Match.com All of this is important to know because pets are a source of unconditional love in our lives and tonight’s guest will inspire us to truly raise your vibration around the issue of pet care.


	Dr Judy Morgan is a nationally renowned veterinarian certified in acupuncture, food therapy, and chiropractic care for dogs, cats, and horses.  She integrates Eastern and Western medicine in her two award winning practices in New Jersey.  After using traditional Western veterinary medicine to treat her patients for many years, she finally discovered a better way to help them live longer, healthier lives.


	She writes for local and national publications, and has appeared on several television shows promoting pet rescue. Her website is www.drjudymorgan.com


	Follow her on Facebook at Judy Morgan DVM and Twitter @integratedpets.

episodes.title: Dr. Sarah Brown: "The Book of You" the latest breakthrough in self-help
episodes.description:
Are you happy, successful, and understood…

? In your work?

? In the most important relationships in your life?

? In the communities where you live and volunteer? 

If so, congratulations!  That is what we want for everyone.  But, if there is some dimension of your life where you answer NO to these questions, stay tuned, Modern Lovers.

Our guest is Dr. Sarah E. Brown. She is leading the charge to revolutionize the self-help industry through the power of personalization.  An expert on using the results of personality assessments, she has created a way to generate a completely personalized book for each reader… an amazing tool called The Book of You!

Dr. Brown has also co-authored Road to Success with Jack Canfield, New York Times Best Selling author of Chicken Soup for the Soul and The Success Principles, and others. Her website is www.bookofyou.com.

episodes.title: Dr. Valerie Youngblood: Change Your Age
episodes.description:
“Aging is not inevitable.” That may sound like a radical sentence but more and more research is showing this statement to be true. Tonight on Modern Love, we will explore the fascinating connection between medicine, mindfulness and meditation. Trained in Internal Medicine, Dr. Valerie Youngblood says if you change your perception about aging, your body will follow.

After many years of practice, Dr. Valerie became disillusioned with traditional managed care and intuitively knew there was a better way. She became one of the first doctors to be certified in integrative holistic medicine changing her method of practice toward viewing a person in totality, treating the root cause of dis-ease and restoring balance.

Dr. Valerie says this is 21st century medicine called Functional Medicine and it will be the fundamental method of practicing medicine in the future that can be accessed NOW.

She regularly holds seminars, workshops and retreats speaking on the keys to living a balanced healthy lifestyle. Her new book, The Youngblood Code is out now. You will be able to find it on at her website, www.vyoungbloodmd.com, Amazon and a bookstore near you.

episodes.title: Michael Costa: Never Be Wrong Again
episodes.description:
How do you go about making important decisions? Do you go with your gut reaction? Do you make Pro vs. Con lists? Do you consider all options then choose the best one?


	if you could get in a time machine, what would you change about some regrets in your life? Tonight’s guest says you don’t ever have to feel the pain of regret again IF you follow one simple formula. Accomplished business executive, lawyer and bestselling author Michael Costa has a four-point framework for successful decision making that will give you a proven formula to improve decision-making skills and results immediately in your work, home and love lives.


	Learn how to tackle major decisions in life and at work, whether to get married, how to invest your money, how to approach medical choices, and more. His book is called “Never Be Wrong Again” and his website is www.neverbewrongagain.com.

episodes.title: Best of Modern Love Radio: Brian Reeves and Heidi Alfrey
episodes.description:
This is a special encore presentation of Modern Love with Dr. Brenda Wade.

BRYAN REEVES

Bryan's journey has taken him from a disciplined life in the US Military Service to his current, free-flowing purpose as a powerful inspirational speaker and blogger. Bryan currently lights up the web with his humorous, insightful work which appears on sites like The Daily Love, Elephant Journal and more, including his own which is 

www. thiswildwakingjourney. com

 

HEIDI ALFREY 

My next guest says she recognized the importance of living naked in 1983 when she awoke in a jail cell after her third arrest for drinking and driving. That day, Heidi Alfrey stopped lying to herself when she realized the damage addiction had done to her sense of authenticity and self-worth. Through the loving support of two powerful spiritual communities, Alcoholics Anonymous and Unity, she was able to drop her self-defeating patterns of denial and shame and emerge anew. 

Heidi is an ordained Unity minister and holds a Master’s degree in Marriage and Family Therapy. She is an inspiring healer and the founder of Transparent Living Ministries at www.heidialfrey.com

episodes.title: Alicia Young:  The Downton Abbey Effect/Embrace the Past!
episodes.description:
Tonight we have a VERY entertaining show about a secret addiction of mine: Downton Abbey! (Tell funny story about why you loved the show) My guest tonight says Downton Abbey as a show and pop culture touchstone has a lot to teach about relationships and modern love. She says too often we throw out the good from the past in our technological rush to connect. Tonight we’ll explore “The Downton Abbey Effect” with Alicia Young and learn how to mine your own past for beautiful emotional treasures.

Alicia is a US-based TV journalist, author and speaker who has lived in eight countries. (She is not on the run.) Her books run the gamut from modern manners (practical, not prissy) to being an egg donor, to her experience of working for Mother Teresa.  These books have won sixteen awards to date, and are known for their gentle humor.

Alicia is also a dynamic speaker and taps her television background to weave stories around a variety of topics. Her website is www.aliciayoung.net.

episodes.title: Dr. Adam Kleinberg : Wellness for Stressed-Out Parents
episodes.description:
Children are much more likely than not to grow up in a household in which their parents work, and in nearly half of all two-parent families today, both parents work full time, a sharp increase from previous decades. What hasn’t changed: the difficulty of balancing it all. Working parents say they feel stressed, tired, rushed and short on quality time with their children, friends, partners or hobbies, according to a new Pew Research study.

How do we teach our children wellness? And most importantly, how can stressed-out parents maintain balance in our go-go- go world? My guest today has some surprising answers that can bring more richness to your family life, expanding the limits of what modern love looks like. Dr. Adam Kleinberg's mission is to help empower and educate children into a wellness based life. He has recently published his first book, Shine Your Love on the World - Letters to My Daughters. His website is www.shineyourlove.org.

Jack Canfield says: “Adam has provided not only his children- but all of us at any

episodes.title: Kristie Overstreet: Exploring Sexual Fantasies
episodes.description:
Sex. It’s a big topic in our lives but so often gets swept under the sheets…Ever find yourself visualizing steamy scenarios to get yourself turned on? You’re far from the only one. Tonight’s show is about how to get out of your head and open your heart about your most intimate fantasies.

Kristie Overstreet is a psychotherapist and certified sex therapist that specializes in relationships and gender identity. Kristie has been working with clients for the past decade to identify what changes are needed in their lives that will ultimately improve their relationship with themselves and others.

Kristie says: “Not every fantasy needs to be acted on because some may have consequences that could greatly affect your life in many ways. These are different from person to person. Only you can decide what fantasies are safe to be explored and which are not by what type of consequences may occur.”

Her new book “Fix Yourself First: 52 Tips to Stop Ruining Your Relationship” is a must-read. Her website is www.kristieoverstreet.com.

episodes.title: Dr. Tim McCarthy: Deeper Love, Less Conflict
episodes.description:
Truth and love don’t seem like opposites, but they can be. Someone can use truth as a weapon, hurting others. Someone else can try so hard to save someone’s feelings that they fail to confront some serious issues. How do you navigate communication issues in your relationship when one (or both) of you is resistant to change?

Meet. Dr. Timothy McCarthy. He is a PhD psychologist and licensed Marriage & Family Therapist whose practice includes individual therapy and couples therapy, as well as executive coaching. He has developed Relationship Co-Coaching, an approach that helps couples overcome entrenched self-limiting negative patterns. His advice is especially suited for couples wanting to deepen their love and emotional connection, especially for those caught in habitual patterns of conflict.

Dr. Tim’s website is www.drtimmccarthy.com.

episodes.title: Greg Jacobson: Think Yourself Happy
episodes.description:
Would you like to know the secret to creating a $100 million dollar business from scratch? Or even better: how to think yourself happy, successful and RICH? Our esteemed guest tonight is Greg Jacobson, the author of “Think Yourself Happy: Five Ways In Thinking That Will Immediately Improve Your Life.” He’s been featured on ABC, CNN, CBS, iHeart Radio and worked with Christie’s, Sotheby’s, and some of the biggest multinational companies on the planet.

Considered one of the world’s leading strategists for developing a success mindset, Greg has taught hundreds of well-known organizations and high- performing individuals to achieve more, meet objectives faster, and become better team players.



Think Yourself Happy is a simple, easy-to- follow, step-by- step guide, to learning the 5 simple changes in thinking that will show you how to be happier immediately. Greg’s innovative approach to Happily Achieving is based on decades of scientific research in positive psychology.

His website is happilyachieving.com.

episodes.title: Emily Fillorama: How To Re-Parent Yourself
episodes.description:
Modern Lovers, I want you to contemplate these three questions:


	? What does it take to be more extraordinary than you already are?


	? What does it take to become unstoppable?


	? What does it take to live a life of awe and magic?


	If you want your life to be different and to change for the better, YOU have to change. You have to gain the courage to consistently go outside of your comfort zone, which can only happen if you erase your fears, negative self-talk and insecurities.


	Tonight’s guest is the author of the book How to Permanently Erase Negative Self-Talk So You Can Be Extraordinary. Emily Fillorama says leaping into the unknown actually moves you towards self-actualization and that journey begins with learning to “re-parent” yourself. Tonight Emily will provide guideposts on how to unleash true greatness by mastering the inner game of success. A graduate of Cornell University, her professional trainings include psycho-spiritual healing, self-leadership and Neuro-Linguistics Programming (NLP). Emily’s website is


	www.BeMoreExtraordinary.com

episodes.title: Judy Frankel  Topic: Food Secrets Every Woman Should Know
episodes.description:
Tonight’s show is a call to action in the politics of love…self-love that is.  And self love starts with how we see and treat our very own bodies. Our guest tonight is here to spur you into the ultimate act of gratitude: recognizing that what you put into your temple impacts your entire world-view.  


	Judy Frankel is a master gardener, food activist, blogger for The Huffington Post, and author who is leading the movement to fix Washington.  Her book "In Search of The Next POTUS:  One Woman's Quest to Fix Washington, A True Story" gives voters the tools to combat corruption in Congress while choosing a qualified leader for the White House.


	Today, she will be speaking about the five things food companies don't want you to know that could already be affecting your health.


	Judy’s website is www.insearchofthenextpotus.com.

episodes.title: Dr. Susan Heitler: Are You Living With An Emotional Terrorist?
episodes.description:
For many people in relationships, the real success test is how you approach compromise. But for some, this is a minefield full of explosive behavior and triggers. So the question tonight is: are you living with an emotional terrorist? To be clear, we are not talking about abuse of any kind but rather the fear and ineptitude many of us feel when we have to deal with conflict in our love lives.


	Our guest tonight says we must learn to eliminate “terrorist” words that turn smooth-flowing conversations into danger zones. Meet Dr. Susan Heitler. Educated at Harvard and NYU, she writes popular Psychology Today and YourTango.com blogposts that have garnered over seven millions reads. Her Power of Two book and workbook teaches couples the skills for marriage success. Dr. Heitler is frequently interviewed in magazines such as Fitness, Men’s Health, Women’s World, Parenting and the Ladies Home Journal column “Can This Marriage Be Saved?” (which was developed as a TV show I hosted years ago!)


	And get this: in May 2004 Dr. Heitler appeared on the CBS Early Show where anchor Harry Smith introduced her as “the most influential person in my life—my therapist.”


	Her websites are www.poweroftwomarriage.com and www.therapyhelp.com.

episodes.title: Lynn Newman: Get Unstuck: The Good News About Feeling Bad
episodes.description:
Life is full of challenges that help us grow, soar and believe in ourselves over and over again. What would you do if you could always hold on to this truth: there is good news about feeling bad!


	Our guest tonight is a creativity expert with a Masters in Counseling Psychology. Success expert Lynn Newman has emerged as a defining voice in the art of guiding others to exceed their potential and manifest their dream. In order to get unstuck, she believes everything we do is creative: the way we think. The way we problem solve. The way we make the most of our lives. Her goal? To help you create whatever you long to experience and be the artist of your life.


	Lynn is an ongoing contributor for Tiny Buddha, Positively Positive, Wake Up World, Personal Growth and a multitude of other online publications.


	Her website is www.lynnnewman.com

episodes.title: Dr. Sharon Livingston: Best Friend Breakups
episodes.description:
Tonight we’re talking about a topic that’s often swept under the rug….but statistics show 40 percent of us have experienced this deepest darkest pain: what happens when you break up with a trusted friend, your partner-in- crime, the girlfriend you thought would have your back forever? Being dumped by your BFF may feel like the worst betrayal you could ever face.

But in every crisis there’s opportunity, right? This is the story of how a quirky therapist answers the phone one day, only to hear her closest friend say the dreaded words that cut her off forever.

Meet. Dr. Sharon Livingston, one of the most prominent leaders in the field of motivational research. She is the author of “Get Lost Girlfriend: How I Found Myself When My Best Friend Dumped Me.” Dr. Sharon has been featured in in The New York Times, The Washington Post, The Daily News, Newsday, and countless other media outlets. Her website is www.getlostgirlfriend.com.

episodes.title: Best Of Modern Love Radio: Marci Shimoff: Happy for No Reason
episodes.description:
Marci Shimoff is a #1 NY Times bestselling author, a celebrated transformational leader, and one of the nation's leading experts on happiness, success, and unconditional love. She is the author of the runaway bestsellers Love for No Reason and Happy for No Reason, which offer revolutionary approaches to experiencing deep and lasting love and happiness. These books soared to the top of many national bestseller lists including The New York Times, Amazon, and the Wall Street Journaland have been translated into 31 languages.

Marci is also the woman's face of the biggest self-help book phenomenon in history, Chicken Soup for the Soul. Her six bestselling titles in the series, including Chicken Soup for the Woman’s Souland Chicken Soup for the Mother’s Soul, have met with stunning success. Combined, all of her books have sold more than 14 million copies worldwide and have been on the New York Timesbestseller list for a total of 118 weeks. Marci is one of the bestselling female nonfiction authors of all time. In addition, she’s the host of the national PBS television show called Happy for No Reasonand she’s a featured teacher in the international film and book sensation, The Secret.

Dr. Wade is clinical psychologist, author, TV host, and motivational speaker, who inspires thousands of people each month with her dynamic range of events and free teleseminar's.

episodes.title: Julie Christopher: Love and Intuition
episodes.description:
We all know that classic song “Love and Marriage” but tonight we’re exploring the powerful link between “love and intuition”…


	With only $50, a guitar, and not speaking any English, Julie Christopher arrived in Los Angeles as a homeless immigrant. Relying only on instinct & intuition, Julie continued her music career and eventually performed on the Grand Ole Opry stage.


	During her journey, she also published her own yoga training DVD. Many of her clients were entrepreneurs and executives who confided in Julie their challenges and obstacles in business and life…
